CAMPAIGN_NAME: Heavy metals in inshore benthic invertebrates from the Barents Sea - summer 1994
PROTOCOL_COMMENT: Animals were collected at low tide from rocky shores and were kept for 24 h in aerated seawater for defecation, with the only exception of A. marina which was sampled from a sandy tide flat

CAMPAIGN_NAME: Heavy metals in inshore benthic invertebrates from the Barents Sea - summer 1994
PROTOCOL_COMMENT: Sequential multi-element graphite tube atomic absorption spectroscopy (Varian Techtron, SpectrAA-30, GTA-96, wall atomisation) and Zeeman background correction for Cd, Pb, Ni and Cu

CAMPAIGN_NAME: Heavy metals in inshore benthic invertebrates from the Barents Sea - summer 1994
PROTOCOL_COMMENT: Aliquots of approximately 10 mg dried material were digested for 1 h at 96 °C with 50 ml HNO3 (70–71%, Baker Instra-Analysed) in 1.5 ml Eppendorf reaction tubes

CAMPAIGN_NAME: Heavy metals in inshore benthic invertebrates from the Barents Sea - summer 1994
